intro: Guapira fundacionensis, commonly known as the Fundación guapira, is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its woody stems and alternate, ovate leaves with a velvety texture. Its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers are typically pink or purple, blooming in late spring to early summer. Guapira fundacionensis is often found in moist, shaded habitats within cloud forests.
